frameDefinitions: An Agent (or inanimate Cause) affects a Set so that the number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.
The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.
This frame includes words that name medical professionals and is closely related to the Medical_specialties frame.

These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
A System is perceived as complex depending on the intricacy of the interconnectivty of its parts or components.
This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
frameExamples: More and more resources have been devoted to halting rogue nation's <t>proliferation</t> of controlled nuclear technology.
Falling prices and wireless connectivity have <t>breathed new life</t> into the PDA market.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
San Diego freeways are a <t>complex</t> array of poorly maintained roads.
Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who causes the <fen>Set</fen> to increase in number.
The scale along which the <fen>Set</fen> ranges in, i.e., number.
The entity whose amount is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the proliferating occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the number of the <fen>Set</fen>.
The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
This role identifies the medical <fen>Professional</fen>.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
The complete entity or system whose complexity is under consideration.
The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: The reinvigoration <fex>of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.
<fex>We</fex> revitalized the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.
Rock has been rejuvenated creatively and commercially <fex>by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.

New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has revitalized the economy
<fex>in every corner of the state</fex>.
